question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: Who was Immihan Ceren Yasa's employer in 2020?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

content.source_1:
Title: The Intelligent Systems Pioneer: Immihan Ceren Yasa's Journey

In the heart of Stuttgart, Germany, a hub of innovation and discovery thrives - the Max Planck Institute for Intelligent Systems. This esteemed research institute, part of the Max Planck Society, has been at the forefront of cutting-edge research, pushing the boundaries of human knowledge. Among the brilliant minds that have contributed to its success is Immihan Ceren Yasa, a talented researcher who left an indelible mark on the institution. Immihan's story begins in the early 2010s, when she joined the Max Planck Institute for Intelligent Systems as a young researcher. Her fascination with intelligent systems and robotics led her to this prestigious institution, where she would embark on a journey that would shape her career and contribute significantly to the field. One of the most compelling pieces of evidence supporting Immihan's affiliation with the Max Planck Institute is her publication record. A thorough examination of academic databases reveals a string of research papers co-authored by Immihan, bearing the institute's affiliation. For instance, a 2015 paper titled "Soft Bodied Robots for Search and Rescue Applications" lists Immihan as a researcher at the Max Planck Institute for Intelligent Systems. This publication, along with several others, demonstrates her active involvement in the institute's research endeavors. Further evidence can be found in the institute's own records. The Max Planck Institute for Intelligent Systems' website archives feature news articles and press releases from the time, mentioning Immihan's contributions to various projects. A 2013 press release, for example, highlights her work on a soft-bodied robot designed for search and rescue operations, citing her as a key researcher at the institute. Immihan's collaboration with other prominent researchers at the institute is another testament to her affiliation. Her work with Dr. Metin Sitti, a renowned expert in micro- and nano-robotics, is a case in point. Together, they co-authored several papers, including a seminal work on bio-inspired robotics, which was published in a leading scientific journal. This collaboration not only showcases Immihan's expertise but also underscores her integration into the institute's research community. In addition to these academic and institutional records, personal accounts from colleagues and peers provide valuable insights into Immihan's time at the Max Planck Institute. Dr. Sitti, in a personal interview, fondly recalled Immihan's dedication and innovative spirit, praising her contributions to their joint research projects.
content.source_2:
**SEOUL, SOUTH KOREA - MARCH 15, 2041**

Renowned Researcher Immihan Ceren Yasa Joins Republic of Korea Army to Advance Military Technology

In a move that is being hailed as a significant boost to the country's defense capabilities, the Republic of Korea Army has announced the appointment of esteemed researcher Immihan Ceren Yasa to its ranks. As of this month, Dr. Yasa will be working closely with the army's research and development team to explore innovative solutions for the modern battlefield. Dr. Yasa, a leading expert in advanced materials and artificial intelligence, brings with her a wealth of experience in cutting-edge research. Her work has been widely published in top-tier scientific journals, and she has received numerous awards for her contributions to the field. "We are thrilled to have Dr. Yasa on board," said General Ji-Hoon Kim, Chief of Staff of the Republic of Korea Army. "Her expertise will be invaluable in helping us stay ahead of the curve in terms of military technology. We are confident that her work will have a direct impact on our ability to protect our nation and its people." Dr. Yasa expressed her excitement about the new opportunity, stating, "I am honored to be joining the Republic of Korea Army and contributing to the development of innovative solutions that will enhance the safety and effectiveness of our troops. I believe that my research can make a real difference in the field, and I look forward to working with the talented team here." According to sources within the army, Dr. Yasa's initial focus will be on developing advanced materials for use in military applications, such as lightweight yet durable armor and more efficient energy storage systems. She will also be working on integrating AI-powered systems into military operations, with the goal of improving situational awareness and decision-making on the battlefield. The Republic of Korea Army has been investing heavily in research and development in recent years, with a focus on staying ahead of the technological curve in the face of evolving threats from neighboring countries. The addition of Dr. Yasa to the team is seen as a major coup, and is expected to have a significant impact on the army's capabilities in the years to come.
